main_principles.title: Small is beautiful.
main_principles.description: Small things have tremendous advantages over their larger counterparts. Among these is the ability to combine with other small things in the unique and useful ways.

main_principles.title: Make each program do one thing well.
main_principles.description: By focusing on a single task, a program can eliminate much extraneous od that often results in excess overhead, unnecessary conplicated and a lack of flexibility.

sub_principles.title: Allow the user to tailor the environment.
sub_principles.description: UNIX users like the ability to control their environment---all of it. like the UNIX applications decidedly refrain from making decisions about styles of interaction and instead leave the choices to the user.

sub_principles.title: Make operating system kernels small and lightweight.
sub_principles.description: Despite the never-ending push for new features, UNIX developers prefer to keep the most central part of an operating system small. They don't always succeed at this, but thigs is their goal.
